item.title: 210127 Vocabulary List
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. keen adj. 예리한 2. comprehensive adj. 포괄적인, 종합적인 3. by chance phr. 우연히, 뜻밖에 4. complimentary adj. 무료의; 칭찬하는 5. claim v. 얻다 6. pick something up phr. ~을 찾다[찾아오다] 7. venue n. 현장, 장소 8. intermittently

item.title: 하얀 늑대들 X 글귀
item.author: Author
item.description: p. 90 “어떤 사람에게는 큰 감동을 안겨주는 그림이 어떤 사람에게는 낙서에 불과할 것이고, 어떤 사람에게는 끝내주는 음악이 다른 사람에게는 소음이 될 수

item.title: B Positive S01E06 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. grow a pair [Verb] (vulgar,idiomatic) To be brave; to show some courage, especially in a situation in which one has so far failed to do so. - Gideon: You’re a shrink. Can’t you get a copy of the eval and coach her through it? - Drew: Oh, no, no. I couldn’t. That would be cheating. - Samantha: Grow a pair, Bambi. 2. take the high road to behave in

item.title: Modern Family S01E02 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. put one’s foot down 단호한 태도를 취하다. - Phil: Sometimes a man’s gotta put his foot down and do what a man’s gotta do. 2. rub sb the wrong way to annoy someone without intending to. - Mitchell: Her future best friend might be in that class, and I don’t wanna rub anyone the wrong way. 3. start sb off 1. ~

item.title: Modern Family S01E01 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. tell someone off to tell someone that they have done something wrong and that you are angry about it. 야단 치다. - Soccer Mom: Come on, Coach. You gotta take that kid out. - Gloria: You wanna take him out? How about I take you out? - Jay: Honey, honey. - Gloria: Why don’t you worry about your son? He spent the first half with his

item.title: Modern Family S01E16 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. get off to …으로 시작하다. - Cameron: We got off to an awkward start with our pediatrician, a very nice Asian lady named Dr. Miura. 2. queen a gay man. - Cameron: Why do you think the dentist gives me all that free stuff? - Mitchell: Um, because he’s a huge queen and he has a big crush on you. 3. by all

item.title: Modern Family S01E15 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. shoot over 빨리 가다. - Cameron: We’re gonna shoot over to Great Shakes, get a table. 2. pull off (힘든 것을) 해내다[성사시키다]. - Cameron: Now, if we can pull this off, you and your little lady friend will be belly up to a ice cream counter having a milk shake with two

item.title: Modern Family S01E14 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. cold feet [구어] 겁, 공포; 달아나려는 자세. - Barbara: Phil, it’s Barbara. The Pattersons wanna back out of the deal. - Phil: Why? What happened? - Barbara: The wife’s getting cold feet. 2. get one’s ducks in a row To ensure all of the small details or elements are accounted for and in their proper positions before

item.title: Modern Family S01E13 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. come out of the closet Admitting to being gay. - Mitchell: I came out of the closet in my mid-20s. 2. as they come Very. - Jay: These guys don’t understand the gay thing. Why create an awkward situation? That’s all I’m saying. - Mitchell: That’s weird, because your friend Shorty there- gay as they come. 3. put out To be willing to engage in casual sexual activity; be

item.title: Modern Family S01E12 영어 표현
item.author: Author
item.description: 1. old ball and chain one’s wife. - Jay: So, trouble in gay paradise, huh? - Mitchell: He just can’t say no to anybody who needs help. And why do you have to always add the word “gay” where it doesn’t belong? - Jay: Hey, hey, you’re not mad at me. You’re mad at the old balls and chain.
